sentence.Network_en: He did not have much success, but tried not to get too disconsolate.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没有取得过太多的成功，但他努力使自己不要太过沮丧。

sentence.Network_en: Disconsolate, Soapy ceased his unavailing racket.
sentence.Network_cn: 索比怏怏不乐地停止了白费力气的闹嚷.

sentence.Network_en: He looked so disconsolate that It'scared her.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看上去情绪很坏,吓了她一跳.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin disconsolatus, from dis- (expressing reversal) + Latin consolatus (past participle of consolari 'to console')

entry.tran: 沮丧的;忧郁的;郁郁寡欢的
entry.def: Someone who is disconsolate is very unhappy and depressed.

example.ex: He did not have much success, but tried not to get too disconsolate.
example.tran: 他没有取得过太多的成功，但他努力使自己不要太过沮丧。

means.word_mean: 1. sad beyond comforting; incapable of being consoled;

sentences.sentence: "the first dismal dispiriting days of November"
